result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Jason Roth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas Jason Roth
Current: N6580 County Rd X, Albany, WI 53502 United States  (Effective: 03-10-2016)
Prior: 1923 1/2 12th Street, Monroe, WI 53566

Nicholas Jason Roth, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver, Factual basis found. Defendant pled No Contest, Sentenced to $100 plus costs. Payment plan of 50/mo., first payment to occor after 60 days.

Nicholas Jason Roth, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.

Violation - DC.  Issuing Agency - Monroe PD.
  May not possess or consume any intoxicants.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant.
  No contact with residence or premises at 1916 11th St, Monroe WI.
  Defendant shall immediately complete processing at the Monroe Police Department if released.

Nicholas Jason Roth, defendant appeared in Court in custody by video with counsel Guy M. Taylor.
Gary Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.
  Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.
  Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf.
